Interactive Space Weather Story Dashboard
Summary Although the Sun is 93 million miles away from our planet, solar activity can significantly impact our daily lives. “Space weather”—the variations that occur in the space environment between the Sun and Earth—can impact technologies in space and on Earth. Your challenge is to write and illustrate a digital children’s story that explains what space weather is and the varying impacts it has on different people such as farmers, pilots, astronauts, power grid operators, and the general public. You can tell the story from the perspective of a person impacted by space weather or from the point of view of a solar flare or coronal mass ejection (CME) as it approaches Earth. Background The term “space weather” refers to the variations that occur in the space environment between the Sun and Earth, across the solar system, and at each planet, including phenomena such as solar flares, coronal mass ejections (CMEs), and the solar wind—all of which can impact technologies in space and on Earth. Although the Sun is 93 million miles away from our planet, its activity can significantly impact our daily lives in ways we may not realize. Solar flares, CMEs, the solar wind, and solar particle events directed towards Earth can cause beautiful auroras as well as other more challenging societal impacts like Global Positioning System (GPS) signal disruption, loss of radio communications, and financial implications. A significant solar storm hitting Earth has the potential to cause billions of dollars in losses globally due to radio blackouts. While space weather has existed for billions of years, the impacts appear stronger today more than ever due to the heavy societal dependency on technology and infrastructure. It can be assumed that space weather effects will only grow in significance as our use of technology and our dependence on it grow over time. One component that makes space weather particularly interesting is the fact that we are still learning which end-user communities are impacted by the phenomena and in what ways. As more research is done and further conversations with known user communities like farmers are conducted, additional details about space weather impacts become clarified. Space weather can impact everyone’s lives, and the space weather community is working tirelessly to understand the specifics of these impacts and the needs of those impacted to determine ways to mitigate space weather effects. Objectives Your challenge is to write and illustrate a digital children’s story that explains what space weather is and the varying impacts it has on different communities. You can tell your story from the perspective of a person impacted by space weather or from the point of view of a solar flare or CME as it approaches Earth. There is plenty of publicly available information from NASA about space weather and its impacts! Can you creatively use that information to tell the story of space weather in a unique and factual way that is easy to understand? If you choose to tell your story from the perspective of a person, it can be anyone that experiences the effects of space weather first-hand such as astronauts, pilots, taxi/ride share drivers, farmers, park rangers, teachers, chefs, fishers, scientists, engineers, video game producers, lifeguards, photographers, artists, accountants, informational technology (IT) workers, electricians, and more. For example, the story of space weather told from the perspective of a photographer might include tales of chasing and photographing beautiful auroras as well as the experiences that accompany these adventures. If your story is told from the perspective of a person impacted by space weather, you could include the following elements: Definition of space weather A few examples of how space weather impacts Earth A clearly defined character whose point of view will be used to tell the story. For instance: What is the person’s name? How old are they? What do they do? How are they connected to space weather? What challenges do they face? Explanation of how space weather directly and indirectly impacts the person’s life and work. You can also tell the story from the perspective of a solar flare or CME traveling to Earth. If you choose this perspective, you could include: Definition of space weather Definition of a solar flare or CME (whichever you choose as your character) A few examples of how space weather impacts Earth Character traits for the solar flare or CME; for example: What is the solar flare or CME’s name? Describe its personality. Does this solar flare or CME travel to Earth on purpose, or is it an accident, or driven to Earth by some other force? Explanation of what the solar flare or CME experiences on its way to Earth Description of the things on Earth it impacts on its journey Whichever perspective you choose, don’t forget to include images or illustrations to help tell the story! Potential Considerations You may (but are not required to) consider the following: Your target audience can include elementary, middle, or high school students—or students at multiple levels! Can you focus on compelling storytelling through data visualizations? Think about how you could depict the impact of space weather on the lives of those on Earth. For data and resources related to this challenge, refer to the Resources tab at the top of the page. This is my project and now I want to make a webapp using react + tsx and firstly you should create a dashboard page for me , make sure just give me the dashboard page only and The page looks like a professional page in purple theme with gradients of purple and in my dashboard page I have a model of teacher who is teaching to their student which is ready so you just need to make a component at the left side of the dashboard in which that teacher is teaching with a decent background which matches the theme but not looking ockward like the teacher is teaching in space so choose the background carefully and you can also apply a video in the background like shooting starts or twinkeling stars in the background of the main dashboard page or you can use the animations to make the page more interacticve Now talking about the right hand side , so there are multiple cards which are basically showing the multiple cards which are basically story cards like solar flare or coronal mass ejection (CME) as it approaches Earth. and many more topics and make sure that the page is full of animation on each and every component , so that it looks like a professional website and also use media queries in the page

I'll create a professional dashboard page with a purple theme, animations, and the components you described. Here's the complete implementation:

tsx
// Dashboard.tsx
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import './Dashboard.css';

// Types for our story cards
interface StoryCard {
  id: number;
  title: string;
  description: string;
  icon: string;
  color: string;
  animationDelay: string;
}

const Dashboard: React.FC = () => {
  const [activeCard, setActiveCard] = useState<number | null>(null);
  
  // Story cards data
  const storyCards: StoryCard[] = [
    {
      id: 1,
      title: "Solar Flares",
      description: "Explore how massive explosions on the Sun affect our technology",
      icon: "☀️",
      color: "#FF6B6B",
      animationDelay: "0s"
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      title: "Coronal Mass Ejections",
      description: "Learn about billion-ton clouds of plasma traveling to Earth",
      icon: "🌌",
      color: "#9B59B6",
      animationDelay: "0.1s"
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      title: "Aurora Adventures",
      description: "Discover the beautiful lights created by space weather",
      icon: "🌈",
      color: "#3498DB",
      animationDelay: "0.2s"
    },
    {
      id: 4,
      title: "GPS Impacts",
      description: "See how space weather affects navigation systems",
      icon: "🧭",
      color: "#2ECC71",
      animationDelay: "0.3s"
    },
    {
      id: 5,
      title: "Power Grid Effects",
      description: "Understand the impact on our electrical systems",
      icon: "⚡",
      color: "#F39C12",
      animationDelay: "0.4s"
    },
    {
      id: 6,
      title: "Astronaut Stories",
      description: "Learn about space weather from space perspective",
      icon: "👨‍🚀",
      color: "#E74C3C",
      animationDelay: "0.5s"
    }
  ];

  // Animation for stars background
  useEffect(() => {
    const createStar = () => {
      const star = document.createElement('div');
      star.className = 'star';
      star.style.left = `${Math.random() * 100}%`;
      star.style.top = `${Math.random() * 100}%`;
      star.style.animationDelay = `${Math.random() * 5}s`;
      document.querySelector('.stars-background')?.appendChild(star);
    };

    // Create multiple stars
    for (let i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
      createStar();
    }
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="dashboard-container">
      {/* Animated stars background */}
      <div className="stars-background"></div>
      
      {/* Floating particles animation */}
      <div className="floating-particles">
        {[...Array(20)].map((_, i) => (
          <div key={i} className="particle" style={{
            animationDelay: `${Math.random() * 5}s`,
            left: `${Math.random() * 100}%`
          }}></div>
        ))}
      </div>

      <div className="dashboard-content">
        {/* Left Side - Teacher Section */}
        <div className="teacher-section">
          <div className="classroom-container">
            <div className="classroom-background">
              <div className="interactive-board">
                <div className="board-content">
                  <h3 className="board-title">Space Weather Classroom</h3>
                  <div className="solar-system">
                    <div className="sun"></div>
                    <div className="earth-orbit">
                      <div className="earth"></div>
                    </div>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
              
              <div className="teacher-character">
                <div className="teacher-head"></div>
                <div className="teacher-body"></div>
                <div className="teacher-arm"></div>
                <div className="teacher-pointer"></div>
              </div>
              
              <div className="students-group">
                {[...Array(5)].map((_, i) => (
                  <div key={i} className="student" style={{ animationDelay: `${i * 0.2}s` }}>
                    <div className="student-head"></div>
                    <div className="student-body"></div>
                  </div>
                ))}
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

        {/* Right Side - Story Cards */}
        <div className="cards-section">
          <div className="section-header">
            <h1 className="dashboard-title">Space Weather Adventures</h1>
            <p className="dashboard-subtitle">Explore how the Sun affects our daily lives</p>
          </div>
          
          <div className="cards-grid">
            {storyCards.map((card) => (
              <div
                key={card.id}
                className={`story-card ${activeCard === card.id ? 'active' : ''}`}
                style={{
                  animationDelay: card.animationDelay,
                  '--card-color': card.color
                } as React.CSSProperties}
                onMouseEnter={() => setActiveCard(card.id)}
                onMouseLeave={() => setActiveCard(null)}
                onClick={() => setActiveCard(card.id)}
              >
                <div className="card-icon" style={{ backgroundColor: card.color }}>
                  {card.icon}
                </div>
                <div className="card-content">
                  <h3 className="card-title">{card.title}</h3>
                  <p className="card-description">{card.description}</p>
                </div>
                <div className="card-glow" style={{ backgroundColor: card.color }}></div>
              </div>
            ))}
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default Dashboard;

/* Dashboard.css */
.dashboard-container {
  min-height: 100vh;

  overflow: hidden;
  font-family: 'Arial', sans-serif;

  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  pointer-events: none;
}

.star {
  position: absolute;
  width: 2px;
  height: 2px;
  background: white;
  border-radius: 50%;
  animation: twinkle 3s infinite;
}

  0%, 100% { opacity: 0.2; transform: scale(0.5); }
  50% { opacity: 1; transform: scale(1); }
}

This dashboard features:

Left Side (Teacher Section):

  • Animated classroom environment with purple-themed gradient

  • Interactive solar system animation showing Earth orbiting the Sun

  • Animated teacher character pointing at the board

  • Group of student characters with bouncing animations

  • Floating animations and glowing effects

Right Side (Story Cards):

  • 6 animated story cards with unique colors and icons

  • Hover effects with glow animations

  • Staggered entrance animations

  • Professional purple theme with gradient backgrounds

Overall Animations:

  • Twinkling stars background

  • Floating particles throughout the page

  • Smooth transitions and hover effects

  • Pulsing animations for interactive elements

  • Responsive design with media queries

The design is professional, space-themed, and fully animated with a cohesive purple color scheme. The teacher section shows an educational setting without being overly "spacey" - it's a classroom environment that fits the educational theme while maintaining the space weather context through the solar system animation on the board.

// Dashboard.tsx import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import './Dashboard.css'; // Types for our story cards interface StoryCard { id: number; title: string; description: string; icon: string; I'll transform your Space Weather dashboard to match the professional theme of the Intellecto dashboard. Here's the updated code:

tsx
// Dashboard.tsx
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import './Dashboard.css';
import { Bell, Search, Settings, User, LogOut, BookOpen, Globe, Satellite, Zap, Navigation, Cloud } from 'lucide-react';

// Types for our story cards
interface StoryCard {
  id: number;
  title: string;
  description: string;
  icon: React.ReactNode;
  color: string;
  animationDelay: string;
  stats?: string;
}

const Dashboard: React.FC = () => {
  const [activeCard, setActiveCard] = useState<number | null>(null);
  
  // Story cards data with Lucide icons
  const storyCards: StoryCard[] = [
    {
      id: 1,
      title: "Solar Flares",
      description: "Explore how massive explosions on the Sun affect our technology",
      icon: <Zap className="w-6 h-6" />,
      color: "#FF6B6B",
      animationDelay: "0s",
      stats: "X-Class Events: 12"
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      title: "Coronal Mass Ejections",
      description: "Learn about billion-ton clouds of plasma traveling to Earth",
      icon: <Cloud className="w-6 h-6" />,
      color: "#9B59B6",
      animationDelay: "0.1s",
      stats: "Active CMEs: 3"
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      title: "Aurora Adventures",
      description: "Discover the beautiful lights created by space weather",
      icon: <Globe className="w-6 h-6" />,
      color: "#3498DB",
      animationDelay: "0.2s",
      stats: "Aurora Alerts: 8"
    },
    {
      id: 4,
      title: "GPS Impacts",
      description: "See how space weather affects navigation systems",
      icon: <Navigation className="w-6 h-6" />,
      color: "#2ECC71",
      animationDelay: "0.3s",
      stats: "Signal Disruptions: 5"
    },
    {
      id: 5,
      title: "Power Grid Effects",
      description: "Understand the impact on our electrical systems",
      icon: <Satellite className="w-6 h-6" />,
      color: "#F39C12",
      animationDelay: "0.4s",
      stats: "Grid Alerts: 2"
    },
    {
      id: 6,
      title: "Space Weather Science",
      description: "Learn about space weather from scientific perspective",
      icon: <BookOpen className="w-6 h-6" />,
      color: "#E74C3C",
      animationDelay: "0.5s",
      stats: "Research Papers: 47"
    }
  ];

  // Mock user data
  const userProfile = {
    name: "Dr. Sarah Johnson",
    role: "Space Weather Educator",
    email: "s.johnson@space.edu"
  };

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-br from-background via-background to-accent">
      {/* Header */}

                  <Globe className="w-6 h-6" />
                </div>
              </div>
              <div>
                <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold text-foreground">SpaceWeather Explorer</h1>

              </div>
            </div>

            <div className="flex items-center space-x-4">
              {/* Search */}
              <div className="relative hidden md:block">
                <Search className="absolute left-3 top-1/2 transform -translate-y-1/2 text-muted-foreground w-4 h-4" />
                <input
                  type="text"
                  placeholder="Search topics, modules..."
                  className="pl-10 pr-4 py-2 rounded-lg border border-border bg-card text-foreground placeholder-muted-foreground focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-primary/50 transition-all duration-300 w-64"
                />
              </div>

              {/* Notifications */}
              <button className="p-2 rounded-lg hover:bg-accent transition-all duration-300 hover-scale relative">
                <Bell className="w-5 h-5 text-muted-foreground transition-colors" />
                <span className="absolute -top-1 -right-1 w-3 h-3 bg-red-500 rounded-full animate-pulse-soft"></span>
              </button>

              {/* Settings */}
              <button className="p-2 rounded-lg hover:bg-accent transition-all duration-300 hover-scale">
                <Settings className="w-5 h-5 text-muted-foreground transition-colors" />
              </button>

              {/* User Menu */}
              <button className="flex items-center space-x-2 p-2 rounded-lg hover:bg-accent transition-all duration-300 hover-scale">

                <Cloud className="w-6 h-6 text-purple-500" />
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>

          <div className="glass rounded-xl p-6 animate-fade-up" style={{ animationDelay: '0.2s' }}>
            <div className="flex items-center justify-between">

                <p className="text-2xl font-bold text-foreground">8</p>

            <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold text-foreground mb-4">Interactive Space Classroom</h3>
            <div className="classroom-container relative h-96 rounded-lg overflow-hidden">
              <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-br from-purple-900/20 to-blue-900/20">
                {/* Animated stars */}
                <div className="stars-background absolute inset-0">
                  {[...Array(50)].map((_, i) => (
                    <div
                      key={i}
                      className="star absolute bg-white rounded-full"
                      style={{

                  ))}

                {/* Solar System */}

                    <div className="earth-orbit absolute top-1/2 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 border border-blue-400/30 rounded-full animate-spin-slow"
                         style={{ width: '200px', height: '200px' }}>
                      <div className="earth w-8 h-8 bg-gradient-to-br from-blue-400 to-green-500 rounded-full absolute top-0 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2"></div>

                  onMouseEnter={() => setActiveCard(card.id)}
                  onMouseLeave={() => setActiveCard(null)}
                  onClick={() => setActiveCard(card.id)}

                      className="p-3 rounded-lg transition-all duration-300"
                      style={{ backgroundColor: `${card.color}20` }}

                        {card.icon}
                      </div>

AvatarScene.tsx ----- import React, { useRef, useEffect, useState } from "react"; import { Canvas, useFrame } from "@react-three/fiber"; import { OrbitControls, useGLTF, useFBX } from "@react-three/drei"; import * as THREE from "three"; interface AvatarModelProps { talking: boolean; } const AvatarModel: React.FC<AvatarModelProps> = ({ talking }) => { const group = useRef<THREE.Group>(null); const { scene } = useGLTF("/models/teacher.glb") as { scene: THREE.Group }; const idleAnim = useFBX("/animations/Standing_Idle.fbx"); const talkingAnim = useFBX("/animations/Talking.fbx"); const mixer = useRef<THREE.AnimationMixer | null>(null); const idleAction = useRef<THREE.AnimationAction | null>(null); const talkingAction = useRef<THREE.AnimationAction | null>(null); // Initialize animations useEffect(() => { if (scene && idleAnim && talkingAnim) { mixer.current = new THREE.AnimationMixer(scene); idleAction.current = mixer.current.clipAction(idleAnim.animations[0], scene); talkingAction.current = mixer.current.clipAction(talkingAnim.animations[0], scene); idleAction.current.play(); } }, [scene, idleAnim, talkingAnim]); // Switch idle/talking useEffect(() => { if (!mixer.current) return; if (talking) { idleAction.current?.fadeOut(0.3); talkingAction.current?.reset().fadeIn(0.3).play(); } else { talkingAction.current?.fadeOut(0.3); idleAction.current?.reset().fadeIn(0.3).play(); } }, [talking]); // Update mixer each frame useFrame((_, delta) => mixer.current?.update(delta)); // Fallback: show simple box if model/animations fail if (!scene || !idleAnim || !talkingAnim) { return ( <mesh position={[0, 0, 0]}> <boxGeometry args={[1, 2, 1]} /> <meshStandardMaterial color={talking ? "red" : "gray"} /> </mesh> ); } return <primitive ref={group} object={scene} scale={1.5} position={[0, -1.5, 0]} />; }; const AvatarScene: React.FC = () => { const [talking, setTalking] = useState<boolean>(false); const handleSpeak = () => { if (!talking) { const utter = new SpeechSynthesisUtterance( "Hello students, today we will learn about Artificial Intelligence." ); utter.lang = "en-IN"; utter.onstart = () => setTalking(true); utter.onend = () => setTalking(false); speechSynthesis.speak(utter); } else { speechSynthesis.cancel(); setTalking(false); } }; return ( <div style={{ width: "100vw", height: "100vh", position: "relative" }}> <Canvas camera={{ position: [0, 1.0, 3], fov: 40 }}> <ambientLight intensity={0.9} /> <directionalLight position={[2, 2, 5]} intensity={3} /> <OrbitControls enableZoom={false} /> <AvatarModel talking={talking} /> </Canvas> <button onClick={handleSpeak} style={{ position: "absolute", bottom: 20, left: "50%", transform: "translateX(-50%)", zIndex: 10, padding: "12px 24px", fontSize: "18px", borderRadius: "8px", background: talking ? "red" : "green", color: "white", border: "none", cursor: "pointer", }} > {talking ? "Stop" : "Speak"} </button> </div> ); }; export default AvatarScene; I want to integrate this thing at the place of this {/* Left Side - Interactive Classroom */} <div className="glass rounded-xl p-6 animate-fade-up"> <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold text-foreground mb-4">Interactive Space Classroom</h3> <div className="classroom-container relative h-96 rounded-lg overflow-hidden"> <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-br from-purple-900/20 to-blue-900/20"> {/* Solar System */} <div className="absolute top-1/2 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2"> <div className="relative"> <div className="sun w-16 h-16 bg-gradient-to-br from-yellow-400 to-orange-500 rounded-full shadow-lg shadow-orange-500/30 animate-pulse"></div> <div className="earth-orbit absolute top-1/2 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 border border-blue-400/30 rounded-full animate-spin-slow" style={{ width: '200px', height: '200px' }}> <div className="earth w-8 h-8 bg-gradient-to-br from-blue-400 to-green-500 rounded-full absolute top-0 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2"></div> </div> </div> </div> {/* Teacher and Students */} <div className="absolute bottom-4 left-4 flex items-end space-x-4"> {/* Teacher */} <div className="flex flex-col items-center"> <div className="teacher w-12 h-16 bg-gradient-to-br from-purple-500 to-blue-500 rounded-t-lg rounded-b-md"></div> <div className="teacher-head w-8 h-8 bg-pink-300 rounded-full -mt-2 border-2 border-white"></div> </div> {/* Students */} <div className="flex space-x-2"> {[...Array(4)].map((_, i) => ( <div key={i} className="flex flex-col items-center"> <div className="student w-8 h-12 bg-gradient-to-br from-green-400 to-blue-400 rounded-t-lg rounded-b-md"></div> <div className="student-head w-6 h-6 bg-yellow-300 rounded-full -mt-1 border-2 border-white"></div> </div> ))} </div> </div> </div> </div> </div>

// Types for our story cards
interface StoryCard {
  id: number;
  title: string;
  description: string;
  icon: React.ReactNode;
  color: string;
  animationDelay: string;
  stats?: string;
}

const Dashboard: React.FC = () => {
  const [activeCard, setActiveCard] = useState<number | null>(null);
  
  // Story cards data with Lucide icons
  const storyCards: StoryCard[] = [
    {
      id: 1,

      icon: <Zap className="w-6 h-6" />,

    },
    {
      id: 2,

      description: "Learn about billion-ton clouds of plasma traveling to Earth",
      icon: <Cloud className="w-6 h-6" />,
      color: "#9B59B6",
      animationDelay: "0.1s",
      stats: "Active CMEs: 3"
    },
    {
      id: 3,

      stats: "Aurora Alerts: 8"
    },
    {
      id: 4,

      description: "Understand the impact on our electrical systems",
      icon: <Satellite className="w-6 h-6" />,
      color: "#F39C12",
      animationDelay: "0.4s",
      stats: "Grid Alerts: 2"

  );
};

Now, let me also provide you with an updated version of the AvatarScene component that's better integrated with your dashboard theme:

tsx
// AvatarScene.tsx
import React, { useRef, useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { Canvas, useFrame } from "@react-three/fiber";
import { OrbitControls, useGLTF, useFBX } from "@react-three/drei";
import * as THREE from "three";

interface AvatarModelProps {
  talking: boolean;
}

const AvatarModel: React.FC<AvatarModelProps> = ({ talking }) => {
  const group = useRef<THREE.Group>(null);

  const { scene } = useGLTF("/models/teacher.glb") as { scene: THREE.Group };
  const idleAnim = useFBX("/animations/Standing_Idle.fbx");
  const talkingAnim = useFBX("/animations/Talking.fbx");

  const mixer = useRef<THREE.AnimationMixer | null>(null);
  const idleAction = useRef<THREE.AnimationAction | null>(null);
  const talkingAction = useRef<THREE.AnimationAction | null>(null);

  // Initialize animations
  useEffect(() => {
    if (scene && idleAnim && talkingAnim) {
      mixer.current = new THREE.AnimationMixer(scene);
      idleAction.current = mixer.current.clipAction(idleAnim.animations[0], scene);
      talkingAction.current = mixer.current.clipAction(talkingAnim.animations[0], scene);
      idleAction.current.play();
    }
  }, [scene, idleAnim, talkingAnim]);

  // Switch idle/talking
  useEffect(() => {
    if (!mixer.current) return;
    if (talking) {
      idleAction.current?.fadeOut(0.3);
      talkingAction.current?.reset().fadeIn(0.3).play();
    } else {
      talkingAction.current?.fadeOut(0.3);
      idleAction.current?.reset().fadeIn(0.3).play();
    }
  }, [talking]);

  // Update mixer each frame
  useFrame((_, delta) => mixer.current?.update(delta));

  // Fallback: show simple box if model/animations fail
  if (!scene || !idleAnim || !talkingAnim) {
    return (
      <mesh position={[0, 0, 0]}>
        <boxGeometry args={[1, 2, 1]} />
        <meshStandardMaterial color={talking ? "#667eea" : "#764ba2"} />
      </mesh>
    );
  }

  return <primitive ref={group} object={scene} scale={1.5} position={[0, -1.5, 0]} />;
};

const AvatarScene: React.FC = () => {
  const [talking, setTalking] = useState<boolean>(false);

  const handleSpeak = () => {
    if (!talking) {
      const utter = new SpeechSynthesisUtterance(
        "Hello students! Welcome to our Space Weather Explorer. Today we'll learn about solar flares, coronal mass ejections, and how space weather affects our daily lives on Earth."
      );
      utter.lang = "en-US";
      utter.rate = 0.9;
      utter.pitch = 1.0;
      utter.onstart = () => setTalking(true);
      utter.onend = () => setTalking(false);
      speechSynthesis.speak(utter);
    } else {
      speechSynthesis.cancel();
      setTalking(false);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div style={{ width: "100%", height: "100%", position: "relative" }}>
      <Canvas camera={{ position: [0, 1.0, 3], fov: 40 }}>
        <color attach="background" args={['#1a1b26']} />
        <ambientLight intensity={0.9} />
        <directionalLight position={[2, 2, 5]} intensity={3} />
        <OrbitControls 
          enableZoom={true} 
          enablePan={true}
          minDistance={2}
          maxDistance={6}
          enableDamping
          dampingFactor={0.05}
        />
        <AvatarModel talking={talking} />
      </Canvas>

      <button
        onClick={handleSpeak}
        className="avatar-speak-button"
        style={{
          position: "absolute",
          bottom: "20px",
          left: "50%",
          transform: "translateX(-50%)",
          zIndex: 10,
          padding: "10px 20px",
          fontSize: "14px",
          borderRadius: "8px",
          background: talking ? "linear-gradient(135deg, #FF6B6B, #FF8E8E)" : "linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea, #764ba2)",
          color: "white",
          border: "none",
          cursor: "pointer",
          fontFamily: 'Inter, sans-serif',
          fontWeight: '600',
          boxShadow: '0 4px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3)',
          transition: 'all 0.3s ease',
        }}
        onMouseEnter={(e) => {
          e.currentTarget.style.transform = 'translateX(-50%) scale(1.05)';
        }}
        onMouseLeave={(e) => {
          e.currentTarget.style.transform = 'translateX(-50%) scale(1)';
        }}
      >
        {talking ? "⏹️ Stop Lesson" : "🎤 Start Lesson"}
      </button>
    </div>
  );
};

export default AvatarScene;

  50% { opacity: 0.5; }
